resource.name: Police Incidents
resource.description:
This dataset represents the Dallas Police Public Data - RMS Incidents beginning June 1, 2014 to current-date. The Dallas Police Department strives to collect and disseminate police report information in a timely, accurate manner. This information reflects crimes as reported to the Dallas Police Department as of the current date. Crime classifications are based upon preliminary information supplied to the Dallas Police Department by the reporting parties and the preliminary classifications may be changed at a later date based upon additional investigation. Therefore, the Dallas Police Department does not guarantee (either expressed or implied) the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or correct sequencing of the information contained herein and the information should not be used for comparison purposes over time. The Dallas Police Department will not be responsible for any error or omission, or for the use of, or the results obtained from the use of this information.

This online site is an attempt to make it easier for citizens to access offense reports. In disseminating this crime information, we must also comply with current laws that regulate the release of potentially sensitive and confidential information. To ensure that privacy concerns are protected and legal standards are met, report data is "filtered" prior to being made available to the public. Among the exclusions are:

1.) Sexually oriented offenses
2.) Offenses where juveniles or children (individuals under 17 years of age) are the victim or suspect
3.) Listing of property items that are considered evidence
4.) Social Service Referral offenses
5.) Identifying vehicle information in certain offenses

resource.name: FY2020 Dallas Animal Shelter Data
resource.description:
“Helping Dallas be a safe, compassionate, and healthy place for people and animals”.

Dallas Animal Shelter Data pertains to operational processes carried out by shelter personnel who assist citizens by receiving surrendered and stray animals, facilitating adoptions, transferring animals to rescue groups, and providing care to the animals in the shelter every day. Shelter personnel document their work using Chameleon software, an animal shelter management program. The Dallas Animal Shelter Data is updated daily to help citizens better understanding the operational processes that the shelter personnel perform daily for the animals and citizens of the City of Dallas. The period covered goes from October 01, 2017 to Present

resource.name: Restaurant and Food Establishment Inspections (October 2016 to Present)
resource.description:
This data set is intended to communicate the name of establishment,  the physical location of the establishment,  the date the inspection was conducted, the overall score for the inspection, and the point deduction for the individual violations. 

Disclaimer: The inspection data represents a specific period in time.  It does not represent the ownership of the establishment or the full history of the establishment.

Code indicating the inspection type, such as Routine, Follow-up, 

Complaint, Temporary and Mobile. 

• Routine Inspections – are conducted at least once every six 

months

• Follow-up Inspections –  are conducted as a result of poor 

sanitation issues, low scores

• Complaints Inspections – General Sanitation/Hygienic Practices 

/Illness Investigation, Smoking and Other  

• Temporary – the City of Dallas Office of Special Events provides 

a listing of public events being held involving food and the 

Consumer Health Division provides guidance and inspects 

• Mobile – the various mobile food units are inspected annually 

with random inspections conducted during the year

The Program Identifier allows users to add a
description for a General Health Program record
that identifies one general health program from
another. For example, two programs
(restaurants) at one facility can have the same
Program/Element code (1600 - Food). The
PROGRAM_IDENTIFIER field allows users to add
a description for differentiating the two (The
Moonlight Room and The Laguna Lounge).
Date the inspection for the facility was performed.

The aggregate score from the inspection violations.

Please note not every violation will reflect a point deduction as establishments are allowed to correct violations during the inspection process, and therefore no reduction in the overall score is reflected for the violation.

resource.name: Code Violations
resource.description: There are over 200 violations that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of neighborhood life.  The most common are high weeds, litter, junk motor vehicles, and bulky trash.  Some are more health related like mosquitoes.  Others are environmental such as water conservation.  The annual volume of reported code violations is approximately 200,000 annually.  For the purpose of this data set, cases are grouped into four categories:  structure, nuisance, zoning and other.

resource.name: Dallas City Council Voting Record
resource.description: This report is a summary based on the votes cast by members of the City Council and the final results of that voting.   Detail includes meeting date, item description, member name/district, vote cast (YES/NO), or reason for not voting:  abstain due to conflict (ABSTAIN); absent when vote taken (AWVT); absent on city business (ABSNT-CB); absent for personal reasons (ABSNT).   This report can be sorted to preference of the viewer.

resource.name: FY 2017 Dallas Animal Shelter Data
resource.description:
“Helping Dallas be a safe, compassionate, and healthy place for people and animals”.

Dallas Animal Shelter Data pertains to operational processes carried out by shelter personnel who assist citizens by receiving surrendered and stray animals, facilitating adoptions, transferring animals to rescue groups, and providing care to the animals in the shelter every day. Shelter personnel document their work using Chameleon software, an animal shelter management program. The Dallas Animal Shelter Data is updated daily to help citizens better understanding the operational processes that the shelter personnel perform daily for the animals and citizens of the City of Dallas. The start date is October 01, 2016

resource.name: 311 Service Requests (October 1, 2016 to September 30, 2018)
resource.description:
There are over 400 service requests types that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of life of our citizens, neighborhoods, and communities. The most popular service requests include but are not limited to animal services requests, high weeds, junk motor vehicles, and a number of other code compliance-related issues. Requests that deal with streets and mobility such as street and pot hole repair are also very common. 311 also receives requests to address environmental issues such as water conservation and air quality complaints. 
This dataset represents all Service Request from October 1, 2016 to present.

Unique ID given to each documented request for a city service; the first two digits designate the last two digits of the calendar year the service request was created (e.g., 16 = 2016)

resource.name: Animals Inventory
resource.description:
“Helping Dallas be a safe, compassionate, and healthy place for people and animals”.

Dallas Animals Inventory Data pertains to live animals currently at the shelter.

Shelter personnel assist citizens by receiving surrendered and stray animals, facilitating adoptions, transferring animals to rescue groups, and providing care to the animals in the shelter every day. Shelter personnel document their work using Chameleon software, an animal shelter management program. 

The Animals Inventory Dataset is updated every hour and provides an updated record of all animals currently at hand at the Shelter.

resource.name: DAS FY 2018
resource.description:
“Helping Dallas be a safe, compassionate, and healthy place for people and animals”.

Dallas Animal Shelter Data pertains to operational processes carried out by shelter personnel who assist citizens by receiving surrendered and stray animals, facilitating adoptions, transferring animals to rescue groups, and providing care to the animals in the shelter every day. Shelter personnel document their work using Chameleon software, an animal shelter management program. The Dallas Animal Shelter Data is updated daily to help citizens better understanding the operational processes that the shelter personnel perform daily for the animals and citizens of the City of Dallas. The period covered goes from October 01, 2017 through September 30, 2018.

resource.name: FY 2017 Dallas Animals Field Data
resource.description:
“Helping Dallas be a safe, compassionate, and healthy place for people and animals”.

Dallas Animal Services data that pertains to operations by Animal Services Officers (ASO) who respond to calls in the field throughout the City of Dallas. ASO’s document their work using Chameleon software, an animal shelter software program. The document will be updated on a daily basis, so that citizens have a greater understanding of what ASO’s are doing in the neighborhoods of Dallas. Start date is October 01, 2016

resource.name: 311 Service Requests (October 1, 2019 to Present)
resource.description:
There are over 400 service requests types that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of life of our citizens, neighborhoods, and communities. The most popular service requests include but are not limited to animal services requests, high weeds, junk motor vehicles, and a number of other code compliance-related issues. Requests that deal with streets and mobility such as street and pot hole repair are also very common. 311 also receives requests to address environmental issues such as water conservation and air quality complaints. 
This dataset represents all Service Request from October 1, 2019 to present.

resource.name: FY 2017 CoD Budget & Finance Story
resource.description:
Open Budget is part of our commitment to improving transparency by providing an in-depth view of the City’s financial information. 
This site provides a simpler means of exploring and analyzing the City’s Operating Budget. The charts, graphs, and tables are all highly interactive and will allow users with or without budget experience to better understand how the City allocates funds.
While this site provides a way for users to interactively explore the budget, the City’s adopted budget books are available online and provide additional information related to each City service. Additionally, the Office of Financial Services prepares a monthly Financial Forecast Report that provides information on current expenses as well as year-end expense and revenue projections.

http://financialtransparency.dallascityhall.com/financial/financial_docs.html

http://financialtransparency.dallascityhall.com/financial_services/pdf/FinancialForecast.pdf

resource.name: Building Inspection Certificates Of Occupancy
resource.description:
The Dallas Development Code requires that "Except for single family and duplex uses, a person shall not use or change the use of a building, a portion of a building, or land without obtaining a certificate of occupancy from the building official." 
A new CO is needed for:
•The first use of land or a building 
•A change of use of land or a building  
•A change of tenant on an existing CO, or  
•An existing use increases or decreases floor area

resource.name: FY2018 Animals Inventory
resource.description:
“Helping Dallas be a safe, compassionate, and healthy place for people and animals”.

Dallas Animals Inventory Data pertains to live animals currently at the shelter.

Shelter personnel assist citizens by receiving surrendered and stray animals, facilitating adoptions, transferring animals to rescue groups, and providing care to the animals in the shelter every day. Shelter personnel document their work using Chameleon software, an animal shelter management program. 

The Animals Inventory Dataset is updated every hour and provides an updated record of all animals currently at hand at the Shelter. The period covered by this dataset goes from October 01, 2017 - September 30, 2018.

resource.name: Restaurant and Food Establishment Score Range
resource.description:
This data set is intended to communicate the name of establishment,  the physical location of the establishment,  the date the inspection was conducted, the overall score for the inspection, and the point deduction for the individual violations. 

Disclaimer: The inspection data represents a specific period in time.  It does not represent the ownership of the establishment or the full history of the establishment.
resource.attribution: Code Compliance Services Department, Consumer Health Division
columns_description:
The aggregate score from the inspection violations.

Please note not every violation will reflect a point deduction as establishments are allowed to correct violations during the inspection process, and therefore no reduction in the overall score is reflected for the violation.

The Program Identifier allows users to add a
description for a General Health Program record
that identifies one general health program from
another. For example, two programs
(restaurants) at one facility can have the same
Program/Element code (1600 - Food). The
PROGRAM_IDENTIFIER field allows users to add
a description for differentiating the two (The
Moonlight Room and The Laguna Lounge).

resource.name: Code Violation Activities
resource.description: Activities are actions taken by code staff regarding violations reported.  They are grouped into four categories: complaints, investigation and resolution.  When a complaint is received it is assigned to an inspector who visits the location and determines if there is a violation.  If found, the property owner is notified and ask to correct the problem.  If the problem persists, the property owner can receive a citation; or the city will abate the violation and charge the owner for the cost of the services.  Either way, violations are eventually abated.

resource.name: 311 Service Requests Citywide Map
resource.description:
There are over 400 service requests types that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of life of our citizens, neighborhoods, and communities. The most popular service requests include but are not limited to animal services requests, high weeds, junk motor vehicles, and a number of other code compliance-related issues. Requests that deal with streets and mobility such as street and pot hole repair are also very common. 311 also receives requests to address environmental issues such as water conservation and air quality complaints. 

This dataset represents all Service Requests for the fiscal year time period of October 1, 2016 to present.

resource.name: New Crime Watch
resource.description:
This dataset represents the Dallas Police Public Data - RMS Incidents beginning June 1, 2014 to current-date. The Dallas Police Department strives to collect and disseminate police report information in a timely, accurate manner. This information reflects crimes as reported to the Dallas Police Department as of the current date. Crime classifications are based upon preliminary information supplied to the Dallas Police Department by the reporting parties and the preliminary classifications may be changed at a later date based upon additional investigation. Therefore, the Dallas Police Department does not guarantee (either expressed or implied) the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or correct sequencing of the information contained herein and the information should not be used for comparison purposes over time. The Dallas Police Department will not be responsible for any error or omission, or for the use of, or the results obtained from the use of this information.

This online site is an attempt to make it easier for citizens to access offense reports. In disseminating this crime information, we must also comply with current laws that regulate the release of potentially sensitive and confidential information. To ensure that privacy concerns are protected and legal standards are met, report data is "filtered" prior to being made available to the public. Among the exclusions are:

1.) Sexually oriented offenses
2.) Offenses where juveniles or children (individuals under 17 years of age) are the victim or suspect
3.) Listing of property items that are considered evidence
4.) Social Service Referral offenses
5.) Identifying vehicle information in certain offenses

resource.name: Shelter Animal Adoption Report
resource.description:
“Helping Dallas be a safe, compassionate, and healthy place for people and animals”.

Dallas Animal Shelter Data pertains to operational processes carried out by shelter personnel who assist citizens by receiving surrendered and stray animals, facilitating adoptions, transferring animals to rescue groups, and providing care to the animals in the shelter every day. Shelter personnel document their work using Chameleon software, an animal shelter management program. The Dallas Animal Shelter Data is updated daily to help citizens better understanding the operational processes that the shelter personnel perform daily for the animals and citizens of the City of Dallas. The start date is October 01, 2016

resource.name: FY2019 Animals Inventory
resource.description:
“Helping Dallas be a safe, compassionate, and healthy place for people and animals”.

Dallas Animals Inventory Data pertains to live animals currently at the shelter.

Shelter personnel assist citizens by receiving surrendered and stray animals, facilitating adoptions, transferring animals to rescue groups, and providing care to the animals in the shelter every day. Shelter personnel document their work using Chameleon software, an animal shelter management program. 

The Animals Inventory Dataset is updated every hour and provides an updated record of all animals currently at hand at the Shelter. The period covered by this dataset goes from October 01, 2018 - September 30, 2019.

resource.name: 911 Calls - Burglary
resource.description:
This dataset represents the Dallas Police Public Data related to Accidents - RMS Incidents beginning June 1, 2014 to current-date. The Dallas Police Department strives to collect and disseminate police report information in a timely, accurate manner. This information reflects crimes as reported to the Dallas Police Department as of the current date. Crime classifications are based upon preliminary information supplied to the Dallas Police Department by the reporting parties and the preliminary classifications may be changed at a later date based upon additional investigation. Therefore, the Dallas Police Department does not guarantee (either expressed or implied) the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or correct sequencing of the information contained herein and the information should not be used for comparison purposes over time. The Dallas Police Department will not be responsible for any error or omission, or for the use of, or the results obtained from the use of this information.

This online site is an attempt to make it easier for citizens to access offense reports. In disseminating this crime information, we must also comply with current laws that regulate the release of potentially sensitive and confidential information. To ensure that privacy concerns are protected and legal standards are met, report data is "filtered" prior to being made available to the public. Among the exclusions are:

1.) Sexually oriented offenses
2.) Offenses where juveniles or children (individuals under 17 years of age) are the victim or suspect
3.) Listing of property items that are considered evidence
4.) Social Service Referral offenses
5.) Identifying vehicle information in certain offenses

resource.name: Code Violations
resource.description: There are over 200 violations that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of neighborhood life.  The most common are high weeds, litter, junk motor vehicles, and bulky trash.  Some are more health related like mosquitoes.  Others are environmental such as water conservation.  The annual volume of reported code violations is approximately 200,000 annually.  For the purpose of this data set, cases are grouped into four categories:  structure, nuisance, zoning and other.

resource.name: Rainfall Report
resource.description:
This dataset provides a summary of the rainfall in the city. The City places sensors throughout the City to measure rainfall. This data provides readings in a variety of increments to enable its consumers to be informed of rainfall rates/amounts, by location, within an elapsed time span.

This information is provided with the understanding that it is not guaranteed to be correct or complete and conclusions drawn from such information are the sole responsibility of the user.

resource.name: Operation Trinity's Trident
resource.description:
There are over 400 service requests types that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of life of our citizens, neighborhoods, and communities. The most popular service requests include but are not limited to animal services requests, high weeds, junk motor vehicles, and a number of other code compliance-related issues. Requests that deal with streets and mobility such as street and pot hole repair are also very common. 311 also receives requests to address environmental issues such as water conservation and air quality complaints. 
This dataset represents all Service Request from October 1, 2018 to present.

resource.name: Public Safety - Police Incidents
resource.description:
This dataset represents the Dallas Police Public Data - RMS Incidents beginning June 1, 2014 to current-date. The Dallas Police Department strives to collect and disseminate police report information in a timely, accurate manner. This information reflects crimes as reported to the Dallas Police Department as of the current date. Crime classifications are based upon preliminary information supplied to the Dallas Police Department by the reporting parties and the preliminary classifications may be changed at a later date based upon additional investigation. Therefore, the Dallas Police Department does not guarantee (either expressed or implied) the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or correct sequencing of the information contained herein and the information should not be used for comparison purposes over time. The Dallas Police Department will not be responsible for any error or omission, or for the use of, or the results obtained from the use of this information.

This online site is an attempt to make it easier for citizens to access offense reports. In disseminating this crime information, we must also comply with current laws that regulate the release of potentially sensitive and confidential information. To ensure that privacy concerns are protected and legal standards are met, report data is "filtered" prior to being made available to the public. Among the exclusions are:

1.) Sexually oriented offenses
2.) Offenses where juveniles or children (individuals under 17 years of age) are the victim or suspect
3.) Listing of property items that are considered evidence
4.) Social Service Referral offenses
5.) Identifying vehicle information in certain offenses

resource.description:
“Helping Dallas be a safe, compassionate, and healthy place for people and animals”.

Dallas Animal Shelter Data pertains to operational processes carried out by shelter personnel who assist citizens by receiving surrendered and stray animals, facilitating adoptions, transferring animals to rescue groups, and providing care to the animals in the shelter every day. Shelter personnel document their work using Chameleon software, an animal shelter management program. The Dallas Animal Shelter Data is updated daily to help citizens better understanding the operational processes that the shelter personnel perform daily for the animals and citizens of the City of Dallas. The period covered goes from October 01, 2017 through September 30, 2018.

resource.name: City of Dallas Food Inspection Scores
resource.description:
Scores only represent a snapshot of the facility at the time of inspection. Scoring is based on critical vs. non critical violations. Repeated facility names may indicate follow-up inspection of a single permitted activity or an inspection of a different activity in the same facility, i.e. meat, fish or produce departments in a grocery store.

If the restaurant is not listed the following may be occurring: change of ownership, remodeling or it is a new establishment not yet inspected.

For more information about the food scores listed here, please call Food Protection and Education at (214) 670-8083.

resource.name: Dallas Cultural Centers
resource.description: The City of Dallas Office of Cultural Affairs is the custodian of 23 city-owned cultural facilities, where a wide variety of arts and cultural programs are offered for citizens and visitors. These facilities consist of many of our community's most important cultural venues, and when combined, represent more than 1.5 million square feet of space dedicated to arts and cultural functions in our community.

resource.description:
This dataset represents the Dallas Police Public Data - RMS Incidents beginning June 1, 2014 to current-date. The Dallas Police Department strives to collect and disseminate police report information in a timely, accurate manner. This information reflects crimes as reported to the Dallas Police Department as of the current date. Crime classifications are based upon preliminary information supplied to the Dallas Police Department by the reporting parties and the preliminary classifications may be changed at a later date based upon additional investigation. Therefore, the Dallas Police Department does not guarantee (either expressed or implied) the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or correct sequencing of the information contained herein and the information should not be used for comparison purposes over time. The Dallas Police Department will not be responsible for any error or omission, or for the use of, or the results obtained from the use of this information.

This online site is an attempt to make it easier for citizens to access offense reports. In disseminating this crime information, we must also comply with current laws that regulate the release of potentially sensitive and confidential information. To ensure that privacy concerns are protected and legal standards are met, report data is "filtered" prior to being made available to the public. Among the exclusions are:

1.) Sexually oriented offenses
2.) Offenses where juveniles or children (individuals under 17 years of age) are the victim or suspect
3.) Listing of property items that are considered evidence
4.) Social Service Referral offenses
5.) Identifying vehicle information in certain offenses

resource.name: 311 Service Requests by Department
resource.description:
There are over 400 service requests types that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of life of our citizens, neighborhoods, and communities. The most popular service requests include but are not limited to animal services requests, high weeds, junk motor vehicles, and a number of other code compliance-related issues. Requests that deal with streets and mobility such as street and pot hole repair are also very common. 311 also receives requests to address environmental issues such as water conservation and air quality complaints. 

This dataset represents all Service Requests for the fiscal year time period of October 1, 2016 to September 30, 2017.
columns_description: Unique ID given to each documented request for a city service; the first two digits designate the last two digits of the calendar year the service request was created (e.g., 16 = 2016)

resource.name: Open Data Administrative Directive: AD2-53
resource.description: Data is a core aspect of the City operations. This AD has the potential to benefit City staff and the public by making the data accessible. The goal is that every City Department within the City of Dallas will make data available to the public, subject to regulations. As demonstrated by Federal, State and Local data initiatives, data from the City of Dallas can contribute to the effectiveness of internal government operations and also provide a fuel to local innovators to create new products, services, and even new businesses. By engaging entrepreneurs inside and outside of government, this approach will serve as the foundation of a new platform for civic innovation. The ultimate benefactors of this AD will be city departments, non-governmental organizations, academia, industry (including software developers) and members of the public who are interested in or have a specific use for government data. The purpose of this AD shall be carried out with due regard for the efficiency of City operations, and for the safety, security and privacy of its residents and those persons or organizations it holds information about.

Code indicating the inspection type, such as Routine, Follow-up, 

Complaint, Temporary and Mobile.

months

• Follow-up Inspections –  are conducted as a result of poor 

sanitation issues, low scores

• Complaints Inspections – General Sanitation/Hygienic Practices 

/Illness Investigation, Smoking and Other  

• Temporary – the City of Dallas Office of Special Events provides 

a listing of public events being held involving food and the 

Consumer Health Division provides guidance and inspects 

• Mobile – the various mobile food units are inspected annually 

with random inspections conducted during the year

resource.name: Beat 512 Crime Report
resource.description:
This dataset represents the Dallas Police Public Data - RMS Incidents beginning June 1, 2014 to current-date. The Dallas Police Department strives to collect and disseminate police report information in a timely, accurate manner. This information reflects crimes as reported to the Dallas Police Department as of the current date. Crime classifications are based upon preliminary information supplied to the Dallas Police Department by the reporting parties and the preliminary classifications may be changed at a later date based upon additional investigation. Therefore, the Dallas Police Department does not guarantee (either expressed or implied) the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or correct sequencing of the information contained herein and the information should not be used for comparison purposes over time. The Dallas Police Department will not be responsible for any error or omission, or for the use of, or the results obtained from the use of this information.

This online site is an attempt to make it easier for citizens to access offense reports. In disseminating this crime information, we must also comply with current laws that regulate the release of potentially sensitive and confidential information. To ensure that privacy concerns are protected and legal standards are met, report data is "filtered" prior to being made available to the public. Among the exclusions are:

1.) Sexually oriented offenses
2.) Offenses where juveniles or children (individuals under 17 years of age) are the victim or suspect
3.) Listing of property items that are considered evidence
4.) Social Service Referral offenses
5.) Identifying vehicle information in certain offenses

resource.name: 311 Service Requests for Fiscal Year (FY) 2016 Citywide Map
resource.description:
There are over 400 service requests types that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of life of our citizens, neighborhoods, and communities. The most popular service requests include but are not limited to animal services requests, high weeds, junk motor vehicles, and a number of other code compliance-related issues. Requests that deal with streets and mobility such as street and pot hole repair are also very common. 311 also receives requests to address environmental issues such as water conservation and air quality complaints. 

This dataset represents all Service Requests for the fiscal year time period of October 1, 2015 to September 30, 2016.
columns_description: Denotes a point where vertical (y axis) lines intersect on a map

resource.name: Beat 614 Incidents
resource.description:
This dataset represents the Dallas Police Public Data - RMS Incidents beginning June 1, 2014 to current-date. The Dallas Police Department strives to collect and disseminate police report information in a timely, accurate manner. This information reflects crimes as reported to the Dallas Police Department as of the current date. Crime classifications are based upon preliminary information supplied to the Dallas Police Department by the reporting parties and the preliminary classifications may be changed at a later date based upon additional investigation. Therefore, the Dallas Police Department does not guarantee (either expressed or implied) the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or correct sequencing of the information contained herein and the information should not be used for comparison purposes over time. The Dallas Police Department will not be responsible for any error or omission, or for the use of, or the results obtained from the use of this information.

This online site is an attempt to make it easier for citizens to access offense reports. In disseminating this crime information, we must also comply with current laws that regulate the release of potentially sensitive and confidential information. To ensure that privacy concerns are protected and legal standards are met, report data is "filtered" prior to being made available to the public. Among the exclusions are:

1.) Sexually oriented offenses
2.) Offenses where juveniles or children (individuals under 17 years of age) are the victim or suspect
3.) Listing of property items that are considered evidence
4.) Social Service Referral offenses
5.) Identifying vehicle information in certain offenses

resource.name: 311 Homeless Data
resource.description:
There are over 400 service requests types that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of life of our citizens, neighborhoods, and communities. The most popular service requests include but are not limited to animal services requests, high weeds, junk motor vehicles, and a number of other code compliance-related issues. Requests that deal with streets and mobility such as street and pot hole repair are also very common. 311 also receives requests to address environmental issues such as water conservation and air quality complaints. 

This dataset represents all Service Requests for the fiscal year time period of October 1, 2016 to September 30, 2017.

There are over 400 service requests types that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of life of our citizens, neighborhoods, and communities. The most popular service requests include but are not limited to animal services requests, high weeds, junk motor vehicles, and a number of other code compliance-related issues. resource.name: Shelter Animal Final Disposition
resource.description:
“Helping Dallas be a safe, compassionate, and healthy place for people and animals”.

Dallas Animal Shelter Data pertains to operational processes carried out by shelter personnel who assist citizens by receiving surrendered and stray animals, facilitating adoptions, transferring animals to rescue groups, and providing care to the animals in the shelter every day. Shelter personnel document their work using Chameleon software, an animal shelter management program. The Dallas Animal Shelter Data is updated daily to help citizens better understanding the operational processes that the shelter personnel perform daily for the animals and citizens of the City of Dallas. The start date is October 01, 2016

resource.name: Incident History for Villas Del Lago
resource.description:
This dataset represents the Dallas Police Public Data - RMS Incidents beginning June 1, 2014 to current-date. The Dallas Police Department strives to collect and disseminate police report information in a timely, accurate manner. This information reflects crimes as reported to the Dallas Police Department as of the current date. Crime classifications are based upon preliminary information supplied to the Dallas Police Department by the reporting parties and the preliminary classifications may be changed at a later date based upon additional investigation. Therefore, the Dallas Police Department does not guarantee (either expressed or implied) the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or correct sequencing of the information contained herein and the information should not be used for comparison purposes over time. The Dallas Police Department will not be responsible for any error or omission, or for the use of, or the results obtained from the use of this information.

This online site is an attempt to make it easier for citizens to access offense reports. In disseminating this crime information, we must also comply with current laws that regulate the release of potentially sensitive and confidential information. To ensure that privacy concerns are protected and legal standards are met, report data is "filtered" prior to being made available to the public. Among the exclusions are:

1.) Sexually oriented offenses
2.) Offenses where juveniles or children (individuals under 17 years of age) are the victim or suspect
3.) Listing of property items that are considered evidence
4.) Social Service Referral offenses
5.) Identifying vehicle information in certain offenses

resource.name: 311 Service Requests for Fiscal Year (FY) 2017 - Parking
resource.description:
There are over 400 service requests types that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of life of our citizens, neighborhoods, and communities. The most popular service requests include but are not limited to animal services requests, high weeds, junk motor vehicles, and a number of other code compliance-related issues. Requests that deal with streets and mobility such as street and pot hole repair are also very common. 311 also receives requests to address environmental issues such as water conservation and air quality complaints. 

This dataset represents all Service Requests for the fiscal year time period of October 1, 2016 to September 30, 2017.

resource.name: Oak Lawn (Reporting Areas)
resource.description:
This dataset represents the Dallas Police Public Data - RMS Incidents beginning June 1, 2014 to current-date. The Dallas Police Department strives to collect and disseminate police report information in a timely, accurate manner. This information reflects crimes as reported to the Dallas Police Department as of the current date. Crime classifications are based upon preliminary information supplied to the Dallas Police Department by the reporting parties and the preliminary classifications may be changed at a later date based upon additional investigation. Therefore, the Dallas Police Department does not guarantee (either expressed or implied) the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or correct sequencing of the information contained herein and the information should not be used for comparison purposes over time. The Dallas Police Department will not be responsible for any error or omission, or for the use of, or the results obtained from the use of this information.

This online site is an attempt to make it easier for citizens to access offense reports. In disseminating this crime information, we must also comply with current laws that regulate the release of potentially sensitive and confidential information. To ensure that privacy concerns are protected and legal standards are met, report data is "filtered" prior to being made available to the public. Among the exclusions are:

1.) Sexually oriented offenses
2.) Offenses where juveniles or children (individuals under 17 years of age) are the victim or suspect
3.) Listing of property items that are considered evidence
4.) Social Service Referral offenses
5.) Identifying vehicle information in certain offenses

resource.name: Urbandale 311 Service Requests
resource.description:
There are over 400 service requests types that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of life of our citizens, neighborhoods, and communities. The most popular service requests include but are not limited to animal services requests, high weeds, junk motor vehicles, and a number of other code compliance-related issues. Requests that deal with streets and mobility such as street and pot hole repair are also very common. 311 also receives requests to address environmental issues such as water conservation and air quality complaints. 

This dataset represents all Service Requests for the fiscal year time period of October 1, 2016 to September 30, 2017.

resource.name: Beat 153
resource.description:
This dataset represents the Dallas Police Public Data - RMS Incidents beginning June 1, 2014 to current-date. The Dallas Police Department strives to collect and disseminate police report information in a timely, accurate manner. This information reflects crimes as reported to the Dallas Police Department as of the current date. Crime classifications are based upon preliminary information supplied to the Dallas Police Department by the reporting parties and the preliminary classifications may be changed at a later date based upon additional investigation. Therefore, the Dallas Police Department does not guarantee (either expressed or implied) the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or correct sequencing of the information contained herein and the information should not be used for comparison purposes over time. The Dallas Police Department will not be responsible for any error or omission, or for the use of, or the results obtained from the use of this information.

This online site is an attempt to make it easier for citizens to access offense reports. In disseminating this crime information, we must also comply with current laws that regulate the release of potentially sensitive and confidential information. To ensure that privacy concerns are protected and legal standards are met, report data is "filtered" prior to being made available to the public. Among the exclusions are:

1.) Sexually oriented offenses
2.) Offenses where juveniles or children (individuals under 17 years of age) are the victim or suspect
3.) Listing of property items that are considered evidence
4.) Social Service Referral offenses
5.) Identifying vehicle information in certain offenses

This information reflects crimes as reported to the Dallas Police Department as of the current date. Crime classifications are based upon preliminary information supplied to the Dallas Police Department by the reporting parties and the preliminary classifications may be changed at a later date based upon additional investigation. Therefore, the Dallas Police Department does not guarantee (either expressed or implied) the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or correct sequencing of the information contained herein and the information should not be used for comparison purposes over time. The Dallas Police Department will not be responsible for any error or omission, or for the use of, or the results obtained from the use of this information.

This online site is an attempt to make it easier for citizens to access offense reports. In disseminating this crime information, we must also comply with current laws that regulate the release of potentially sensitive and confidential information. To ensure that privacy concerns are protected and legal standards are met, report data is "filtered" prior to being made available to the public. Among the exclusions are:

1.) Sexually oriented offenses
2.) Offenses where juveniles or children (individuals under 17 years of age) are the victim or suspect
3.) Listing of property items that are considered evidence
4.) Social Service Referral offenses
5.) Identifying vehicle information in certain offenses

resource.name: FY2020 Animal Medical Record
resource.description:
“Helping Dallas be a safe, compassionate, and healthy place for people and animals”.
Dallas Animal Medical Data pertains to operational processes carried out by medical personnel who provide care and medical attention to the animals received at Dallas Animal Services. Medical personnel document their work using Chameleon software, an animal shelter management program. The Dallas Animal Medical Data is updated daily to help citizens better understand the operational processes that the medical personnel perform daily for the animals and citizens of the City of Dallas. The period covered by this data set goes from October 01, 2019 - September 30, 2020.

resource.description:
“Helping Dallas be a safe, compassionate, and healthy place for people and animals”.

Dallas Animal Shelter Data pertains to operational processes carried out by shelter personnel who assist citizens by receiving surrendered and stray animals, facilitating adoptions, transferring animals to rescue groups, and providing care to the animals in the shelter every day. Shelter personnel document their work using Chameleon software, an animal shelter management program. The Live Animals at the Shelter Dataset is updated every hour and provides an updated record of all animals currently at hand at the Shelter.

resource.name: Dallas Market Value Analysis - HUD LIHTC
resource.description:
HUD Low Income Housing Tax Credit (LIHTC) projects shapefile.

This dataset in the shapefile format contains geo-located points of projects in the City of Dallas that have used the Low-Income Housing Tax Credit Program available through the Department of Housing and Urban Development. These data were used as a primary dataset to generate the Percent Subsidized factor in the MVA.

resource.name: Dallas Market Value Analysis - Dallas TIF Projects
resource.description:
Point shapefile of projects in Dallas Tax Increment Financing Districts.

This dataset in the shapefile format contains geo-located points of projects with residential units within the City of Dallas Tax Increment Financing Districts. These data show number of units in the project as well as the number of affordable units. These data were used as a primary dataset to generate the Percent Subsidized factor in the MVA.

resource.name: Beat 612 Incidents
resource.description:
This dataset represents the Dallas Police Public Data - RMS Incidents beginning June 1, 2014 to current-date. The Dallas Police Department strives to collect and disseminate police report information in a timely, accurate manner. This information reflects crimes as reported to the Dallas Police Department as of the current date. Crime classifications are based upon preliminary information supplied to the Dallas Police Department by the reporting parties and the preliminary classifications may be changed at a later date based upon additional investigation. Therefore, the Dallas Police Department does not guarantee (either expressed or implied) the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or correct sequencing of the information contained herein and the information should not be used for comparison purposes over time. The Dallas Police Department will not be responsible for any error or omission, or for the use of, or the results obtained from the use of this information.

This online site is an attempt to make it easier for citizens to access offense reports. In disseminating this crime information, we must also comply with current laws that regulate the release of potentially sensitive and confidential information. To ensure that privacy concerns are protected and legal standards are met, report data is "filtered" prior to being made available to the public. Among the exclusions are:

1.) Sexually oriented offenses
2.) Offenses where juveniles or children (individuals under 17 years of age) are the victim or suspect
3.) Listing of property items that are considered evidence
4.) Social Service Referral offenses
5.) Identifying vehicle information in certain offenses

resource.name: 311 Service Requests for Fiscal Year (FY) 2017 - Parking Citywide Map
resource.description:
There are over 400 service requests types that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of life of our citizens, neighborhoods, and communities. The most popular service requests include but are not limited to animal services requests, high weeds, junk motor vehicles, and a number of other code compliance-related issues. Requests that deal with streets and mobility such as street and pot hole repair are also very common. 311 also receives requests to address environmental issues such as water conservation and air quality complaints. 

This dataset represents all Service Requests for the fiscal year time period of October 1, 2016 to September 30, 2017.

resource.name: High Weeds Violations Dallas Map
resource.description: There are over 200 violations that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of neighborhood life.  The most common are high weeds, litter, junk motor vehicles, and bulky trash.  Some are more health related like mosquitoes.  Others are environmental such as water conservation.  The annual volume of reported code violations is approximately 200,000 annually.  For the purpose of this data set, cases are grouped into four categories:  structure, nuisance, zoning and other.

resource.name: Dallas Market Value Analysis - Permit Points
resource.description:
Residential Permit Activity Points shapefile.

This dataset in the shapefile format contains geo-located points of permits in the City of Dallas for new construction, renovation, alteration, addition, or reconstruction. These data span July 2015 through June 2017 and were used as a primary dataset to generate the Percent New Construction, and Percent Rehabilitation factors in the MVA.

resource.name: Beat 613 Incidents
resource.description:
This dataset represents the Dallas Police Public Data - RMS Incidents beginning June 1, 2014 to current-date. The Dallas Police Department strives to collect and disseminate police report information in a timely, accurate manner. This information reflects crimes as reported to the Dallas Police Department as of the current date. Crime classifications are based upon preliminary information supplied to the Dallas Police Department by the reporting parties and the preliminary classifications may be changed at a later date based upon additional investigation. Therefore, the Dallas Police Department does not guarantee (either expressed or implied) the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or correct sequencing of the information contained herein and the information should not be used for comparison purposes over time. The Dallas Police Department will not be responsible for any error or omission, or for the use of, or the results obtained from the use of this information.

This online site is an attempt to make it easier for citizens to access offense reports. In disseminating this crime information, we must also comply with current laws that regulate the release of potentially sensitive and confidential information. To ensure that privacy concerns are protected and legal standards are met, report data is "filtered" prior to being made available to the public. Among the exclusions are:

1.) Sexually oriented offenses
2.) Offenses where juveniles or children (individuals under 17 years of age) are the victim or suspect
3.) Listing of property items that are considered evidence
4.) Social Service Referral offenses
5.) Identifying vehicle information in certain offenses

resource.name: Map Test
resource.description:
There are over 400 service requests types that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of life of our citizens, neighborhoods, and communities. The most popular service requests include but are not limited to animal services requests, high weeds, junk motor vehicles, and a number of other code compliance-related issues. Requests that deal with streets and mobility such as street and pot hole repair are also very common. 311 also receives requests to address environmental issues such as water conservation and air quality complaints. 

This dataset represents all Service Requests for the fiscal year time period of October 1, 2016 to September 30, 2017.

This data set is intended to communicate the name of establishment,  the physical location of the establishment,  the date the inspection was conducted, the overall score for the inspection, and the point deduction for the individual violations. 

Disclaimer: The inspection data represents a specific period in time.  It does not represent the ownership of the establishment or the full history of the establishment.

resource.name: 311 Service Requests for Fiscal Year (FY) 2014
resource.description:
There are over 400 service requests types that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of life of our citizens, neighborhoods, and communities. The most popular service requests include but are not limited to animal services requests, high weeds, junk motor vehicles, and a number of other code compliance-related issues. Requests that deal with streets and mobility such as street and pot hole repair are also very common. 311 also receives requests to address environmental issues such as water conservation and air quality complaints. 

This dataset represents all Service Requests for the fiscal year time period of October 1, 2013 to September 30, 2014.

resource.name: Medical Reason of the Animal Visit
resource.description:
“Helping Dallas be a safe, compassionate, and healthy place for people and animals”.

Dallas Animal Medical Data pertains to operational processes carried out by medical personnel who provide care and medical attention to the animals received at Dallas Animal Services. Medical personnel document their work using Chameleon software, an animal shelter management program. resource.name: Fair Park (Reporting Areas)
resource.description:
This dataset represents the Dallas Police Public Data - RMS Incidents beginning June 1, 2014 to current-date. The Dallas Police Department strives to collect and disseminate police report information in a timely, accurate manner. This information reflects crimes as reported to the Dallas Police Department as of the current date. Crime classifications are based upon preliminary information supplied to the Dallas Police Department by the reporting parties and the preliminary classifications may be changed at a later date based upon additional investigation. Therefore, the Dallas Police Department does not guarantee (either expressed or implied) the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or correct sequencing of the information contained herein and the information should not be used for comparison purposes over time. The Dallas Police Department will not be responsible for any error or omission, or for the use of, or the results obtained from the use of this information.

This online site is an attempt to make it easier for citizens to access offense reports. In disseminating this crime information, we must also comply with current laws that regulate the release of potentially sensitive and confidential information. To ensure that privacy concerns are protected and legal standards are met, report data is "filtered" prior to being made available to the public. Among the exclusions are:

1.) Sexually oriented offenses
2.) Offenses where juveniles or children (individuals under 17 years of age) are the victim or suspect
3.) Listing of property items that are considered evidence
4.) Social Service Referral offenses
5.) Identifying vehicle information in certain offenses

resource.description:
There are over 400 service requests types that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of life of our citizens, neighborhoods, and communities. The most popular service requests include but are not limited to animal services requests, high weeds, junk motor vehicles, and a number of other code compliance-related issues. Requests that deal with streets and mobility such as street and pot hole repair are also very common. 311 also receives requests to address environmental issues such as water conservation and air quality complaints. 

This dataset represents all Service Requests for the fiscal year time period of October 1, 2016 to September 30, 2017.

resource.name: Untitled Visualization - Based on Rainfall Report
resource.description:
This dataset provides a summary of the rainfall in the city. The City places sensors throughout the City to measure rainfall. This data provides readings in a variety of increments to enable its consumers to be informed of rainfall rates/amounts, by location, within an elapsed time span.

This information is provided with the understanding that it is not guaranteed to be correct or complete and conclusions drawn from such information are the sole responsibility of the user.

resource.name: Police_Incidents_2019
resource.description:
This dataset represents the Dallas Police Public Data - RMS Incidents beginning June 1, 2014 to current-date. The Dallas Police Department strives to collect and disseminate police report information in a timely, accurate manner. This information reflects crimes as reported to the Dallas Police Department as of the current date. Crime classifications are based upon preliminary information supplied to the Dallas Police Department by the reporting parties and the preliminary classifications may be changed at a later date based upon additional investigation. Therefore, the Dallas Police Department does not guarantee (either expressed or implied) the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or correct sequencing of the information contained herein and the information should not be used for comparison purposes over time. The Dallas Police Department will not be responsible for any error or omission, or for the use of, or the results obtained from the use of this information.

This online site is an attempt to make it easier for citizens to access offense reports. In disseminating this crime information, we must also comply with current laws that regulate the release of potentially sensitive and confidential information. To ensure that privacy concerns are protected and legal standards are met, report data is "filtered" prior to being made available to the public. Among the exclusions are:

1.) Sexually oriented offenses
2.) Offenses where juveniles or children (individuals under 17 years of age) are the victim or suspect
3.) Listing of property items that are considered evidence
4.) Social Service Referral offenses
5.) Identifying vehicle information in certain offenses

This dataset in the shapefile format contains geo-located points of projects in the City of Dallas that have Public or Subsidized Housing units. These data were used as a primary dataset to generate the Percent Subsidized factor in the MVA.

resource.name: Sector 610 Incidents
resource.description:
This dataset represents the Dallas Police Public Data - RMS Incidents beginning June 1, 2014 to current-date. The Dallas Police Department strives to collect and disseminate police report information in a timely, accurate manner. This information reflects crimes as reported to the Dallas Police Department as of the current date. Crime classifications are based upon preliminary information supplied to the Dallas Police Department by the reporting parties and the preliminary classifications may be changed at a later date based upon additional investigation. Therefore, the Dallas Police Department does not guarantee (either expressed or implied) the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or correct sequencing of the information contained herein and the information should not be used for comparison purposes over time. The Dallas Police Department will not be responsible for any error or omission, or for the use of, or the results obtained from the use of this information.

This online site is an attempt to make it easier for citizens to access offense reports. In disseminating this crime information, we must also comply with current laws that regulate the release of potentially sensitive and confidential information. To ensure that privacy concerns are protected and legal standards are met, report data is "filtered" prior to being made available to the public. Among the exclusions are:

1.) Sexually oriented offenses
2.) Offenses where juveniles or children (individuals under 17 years of age) are the victim or suspect
3.) Listing of property items that are considered evidence
4.) Social Service Referral offenses
5.) Identifying vehicle information in certain offenses

resource.name: Dog Bites by District
resource.description:
“Helping Dallas be a safe, compassionate, and healthy place for people and animals”.

Dallas Animal Services data that pertains to operations by Animal Services Officers (ASO) who respond to calls in the field throughout the City of Dallas. ASO’s document their work using Chameleon software, an animal shelter software program. The document will be updated on a daily basis, so that citizens have a greater understanding of what ASO’s are doing in the neighborhoods of Dallas. Start date is October 01, 2016

resource.name: 311 Service Requests for Fiscal Year (FY) 2017 - Obstruction
resource.description:
There are over 400 service requests types that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of life of our citizens, neighborhoods, and communities. The most popular service requests include but are not limited to animal services requests, high weeds, junk motor vehicles, and a number of other code compliance-related issues. Requests that deal with streets and mobility such as street and pot hole repair are also very common. 311 also receives requests to address environmental issues such as water conservation and air quality complaints. 

This dataset represents all Service Requests for the fiscal year time period of October 1, 2016 to September 30, 2017.

resource.name: Events at Midtown Blvd
resource.description:
This dataset represents the Dallas Police Public Data - RMS Incidents beginning June 1, 2014 to current-date. The Dallas Police Department strives to collect and disseminate police report information in a timely, accurate manner. This information reflects crimes as reported to the Dallas Police Department as of the current date. Crime classifications are based upon preliminary information supplied to the Dallas Police Department by the reporting parties and the preliminary classifications may be changed at a later date based upon additional investigation. Therefore, the Dallas Police Department does not guarantee (either expressed or implied) the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or correct sequencing of the information contained herein and the information should not be used for comparison purposes over time. The Dallas Police Department will not be responsible for any error or omission, or for the use of, or the results obtained from the use of this information.

This online site is an attempt to make it easier for citizens to access offense reports. In disseminating this crime information, we must also comply with current laws that regulate the release of potentially sensitive and confidential information. To ensure that privacy concerns are protected and legal standards are met, report data is "filtered" prior to being made available to the public. Among the exclusions are:

1.) Sexually oriented offenses
2.) Offenses where juveniles or children (individuals under 17 years of age) are the victim or suspect
3.) Listing of property items that are considered evidence
4.) Social Service Referral offenses
5.) Identifying vehicle information in certain offenses

resource.name: Animal Rescued from Field to Shelter | Type
resource.description:
“Helping Dallas be a safe, compassionate, and healthy place for people and animals”.

Dallas Animal Services data that pertains to operations by Animal Services Officers (ASO) who respond to calls in the field throughout the City of Dallas. ASO’s document their work using Chameleon software, an animal shelter software program. The document will be updated on a daily basis, so that citizens have a greater understanding of what ASO’s are doing in the neighborhoods of Dallas. Start date is October 01, 2016
columns_description: Type or nature of animal
Computer generated number assigned to an animal when taken to the shelter

resource.name: Animals Rescued from Field to Shelter
resource.description:
“Helping Dallas be a safe, compassionate, and healthy place for people and animals”.

Dallas Animal Shelter Data pertains to operational processes carried out by shelter personnel who assist citizens by receiving surrendered and stray animals, facilitating adoptions, transferring animals to rescue groups, and providing care to the animals in the shelter every day. Shelter personnel document their work using Chameleon software, an animal shelter management program. The Dallas Animal Shelter Data is updated daily to help citizens better understanding the operational processes that the shelter personnel perform daily for the animals and citizens of the City of Dallas. The start date is October 01, 2016

resource.name: 311 Homeless Request map - last 30 days
resource.description:
There are over 400 service requests types that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of life of our citizens, neighborhoods, and communities. The most popular service requests include but are not limited to animal services requests, high weeds, junk motor vehicles, and a number of other code compliance-related issues. Requests that deal with streets and mobility such as street and pot hole repair are also very common. 311 also receives requests to address environmental issues such as water conservation and air quality complaints. 

This dataset represents all Service Requests for the fiscal year time period of October 1, 2016 to September 30, 2017.

resource.name: 311 Service Requests for Fiscal Year (FY) 2017 - Garbage
resource.description:
There are over 400 service requests types that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of life of our citizens, neighborhoods, and communities. The most popular service requests include but are not limited to animal services requests, high weeds, junk motor vehicles, and a number of other code compliance-related issues. Requests that deal with streets and mobility such as street and pot hole repair are also very common. 311 also receives requests to address environmental issues such as water conservation and air quality complaints. 

This dataset represents all Service Requests for the fiscal year time period of October 1, 2016 to September 30, 2017.

resource.name: FY 2018 Dallas Animal Shelter Data
resource.description:
“Helping Dallas be a safe, compassionate, and healthy place for people and animals”.
Dallas Animal Shelter Data pertains to operational processes carried out by shelter personnel who assist citizens by receiving surrendered and stray animals, facilitating adoptions, transferring animals to rescue groups, and providing care to the animals in the shelter every day. Shelter personnel document their work using Chameleon software, an animal shelter management program. The Dallas Animal Shelter Data is updated daily to help citizens better understanding the operational processes that the shelter personnel perform daily for the animals and citizens of the City of Dallas. The start date is October 01, 2017

resource.name: Nearby Code Violations (75214 zip)
resource.description: There are over 200 violations that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of neighborhood life.  The most common are high weeds, litter, junk motor vehicles, and bulky trash.  Some are more health related like mosquitoes.  Others are environmental such as water conservation.  The annual volume of reported code violations is approximately 200,000 annually.  For the purpose of this data set, cases are grouped into four categories:  structure, nuisance, zoning and other.

resource.name: Incidents September 2018
resource.description:
This dataset represents the Dallas Police Public Data - RMS Incidents beginning June 1, 2014 to current-date. The Dallas Police Department strives to collect and disseminate police report information in a timely, accurate manner. This information reflects crimes as reported to the Dallas Police Department as of the current date. Crime classifications are based upon preliminary information supplied to the Dallas Police Department by the reporting parties and the preliminary classifications may be changed at a later date based upon additional investigation. Therefore, the Dallas Police Department does not guarantee (either expressed or implied) the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or correct sequencing of the information contained herein and the information should not be used for comparison purposes over time. The Dallas Police Department will not be responsible for any error or omission, or for the use of, or the results obtained from the use of this information.

This online site is an attempt to make it easier for citizens to access offense reports. In disseminating this crime information, we must also comply with current laws that regulate the release of potentially sensitive and confidential information. To ensure that privacy concerns are protected and legal standards are met, report data is "filtered" prior to being made available to the public. Among the exclusions are:

1.) Sexually oriented offenses
2.) Offenses where juveniles or children (individuals under 17 years of age) are the victim or suspect
3.) Listing of property items that are considered evidence
4.) Social Service Referral offenses
5.) Identifying vehicle information in certain offenses

resource.name: Where Shelter Animals come from
resource.description:
“Helping Dallas be a safe, compassionate, and healthy place for people and animals”.

Dallas Animal Shelter Data pertains to operational processes carried out by shelter personnel who assist citizens by receiving surrendered and stray animals, facilitating adoptions, transferring animals to rescue groups, and providing care to the animals in the shelter every day. Shelter personnel document their work using Chameleon software, an animal shelter management program. The Live Animals at the Shelter Dataset is updated every hour and provides an updated record of all animals currently at hand at the Shelter.

resource.name: 311 Service Requests FY17 by Department
resource.description:
There are over 400 service requests types that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of life of our citizens, neighborhoods, and communities. The most popular service requests include but are not limited to animal services requests, high weeds, junk motor vehicles, and a number of other code compliance-related issues. Requests that deal with streets and mobility such as street and pot hole repair are also very common. 311 also receives requests to address environmental issues such as water conservation and air quality complaints. 

This dataset represents all Service Requests for the fiscal year time period of October 1, 2016 to September 30, 2017.

resource.name: test
resource.description:
This dataset represents the Dallas Police Public Data - RMS Incidents beginning June 1, 2014 to current-date. The Dallas Police Department strives to collect and disseminate police report information in a timely, accurate manner. This information reflects crimes as reported to the Dallas Police Department as of the current date. Crime classifications are based upon preliminary information supplied to the Dallas Police Department by the reporting parties and the preliminary classifications may be changed at a later date based upon additional investigation. Therefore, the Dallas Police Department does not guarantee (either expressed or implied) the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or correct sequencing of the information contained herein and the information should not be used for comparison purposes over time. The Dallas Police Department will not be responsible for any error or omission, or for the use of, or the results obtained from the use of this information.

This online site is an attempt to make it easier for citizens to access offense reports. In disseminating this crime information, we must also comply with current laws that regulate the release of potentially sensitive and confidential information. To ensure that privacy concerns are protected and legal standards are met, report data is "filtered" prior to being made available to the public. Among the exclusions are:

1.) Sexually oriented offenses
2.) Offenses where juveniles or children (individuals under 17 years of age) are the victim or suspect
3.) Listing of property items that are considered evidence
4.) Social Service Referral offenses
5.) Identifying vehicle information in certain offenses

a listing of public events being held involving food and the 

Consumer Health Division provides guidance and inspects

with random inspections conducted during the year

The Program Identifier allows users to add a
description for a General Health Program record
that identifies one general health program from
another. For example, two programs
(restaurants) at one facility can have the same
Program/Element code (1600 - Food). The
PROGRAM_IDENTIFIER field allows users to add
a description for differentiating the two (The
Moonlight Room and The Laguna Lounge).

Certain transactions are withheld from this register due to requirements for vendor anonymity. resource.name: Incident History for Magnolia Creek
resource.description:
This dataset represents the Dallas Police Public Data - RMS Incidents beginning June 1, 2014 to current-date. The Dallas Police Department strives to collect and disseminate police report information in a timely, accurate manner. This information reflects crimes as reported to the Dallas Police Department as of the current date. Crime classifications are based upon preliminary information supplied to the Dallas Police Department by the reporting parties and the preliminary classifications may be changed at a later date based upon additional investigation. Therefore, the Dallas Police Department does not guarantee (either expressed or implied) the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or correct sequencing of the information contained herein and the information should not be used for comparison purposes over time. The Dallas Police Department will not be responsible for any error or omission, or for the use of, or the results obtained from the use of this information.

This online site is an attempt to make it easier for citizens to access offense reports. In disseminating this crime information, we must also comply with current laws that regulate the release of potentially sensitive and confidential information. To ensure that privacy concerns are protected and legal standards are met, report data is "filtered" prior to being made available to the public. Among the exclusions are:

1.) Sexually oriented offenses
2.) Offenses where juveniles or children (individuals under 17 years of age) are the victim or suspect
3.) Listing of property items that are considered evidence
4.) Social Service Referral offenses
5.) Identifying vehicle information in certain offenses
columns_description: Short description of the offense
Apartment number
Type of Incident
Address where incident occurred
An RMS generated incident number (report number) with the year

resource.name: 311 Service Requests FY17 - Litter Groups
resource.description:
There are over 400 service requests types that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of life of our citizens, neighborhoods, and communities. The most popular service requests include but are not limited to animal services requests, high weeds, junk motor vehicles, and a number of other code compliance-related issues. Requests that deal with streets and mobility such as street and pot hole repair are also very common. 311 also receives requests to address environmental issues such as water conservation and air quality complaints. 

This dataset represents all Service Requests for the fiscal year time period of October 1, 2016 to September 30, 2017.
columns_description: Unique ID given to each documented request for a city service; the first two digits designate the last two digits of the calendar year the service request was created (e.g., 16 = 2016)

resource.description:
“Helping Dallas be a safe, compassionate, and healthy place for people and animals”.

Dallas Animal Services data that pertains to operations by Animal Services Officers (ASO) who respond to calls in the field throughout the City of Dallas. ASO’s document their work using Chameleon software, an animal shelter software program. The document will be updated on a daily basis, so that citizens have a greater understanding of what ASO’s are doing in the neighborhoods of Dallas. Start date is October 01, 2016

resource.name: Council Districts
resource.description: As required by Dallas City Charter, redistricting of elected official districts is requred every ten years based on updated Census information. This shapefile represents the updated city council district boundaries as approved by the Dallas City Council on October 5, 2011. Boundaries are based upon 2010 Census Block geography and may not conform with other data. Where street boundaries serve as district borders, the entire right of way is assigned to the northern or eastern boundary.Utilizing this file with non-census shapefiles may result in discrepancies between boundaries. To identify appropriate boundaries, please use in conjunction with the 2010 Census edges and block files.

resource.description:
“Helping Dallas be a safe, compassionate, and healthy place for people and animals”.

Dallas Animal Shelter Data pertains to operational processes carried out by shelter personnel who assist citizens by receiving surrendered and stray animals, facilitating adoptions, transferring animals to rescue groups, and providing care to the animals in the shelter every day. Shelter personnel document their work using Chameleon software, an animal shelter management program. 

This dataset reports activities between October 01, 2015 and September 30, 2016

resource.name: 311 Service Requests for Fiscal Year (FY) 2020 - Bulk
resource.description:
There are over 400 service requests types that are reported in the 311 system that affect the quality of life of our citizens, neighborhoods, and communities. The most popular service requests include but are not limited to animal services requests, high weeds, junk motor vehicles, and a number of other code compliance-related issues. Requests that deal with streets and mobility such as street and pot hole repair are also very common. 311 also receives requests to address environmental issues such as water conservation and air quality complaints.

This dataset represents all Service Requests for the fiscal year time period of October 1, 2019 to September 30, 2020.
